intro: Perymenium simulans, commonly known as the false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other species known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy surface, while its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
